column5: I need to have a letter form my wife for me to take my son to canada with me. Does anyone if there is a form letter that I could copy to fill out with our information?
Check with Canada Customs to be sure. In Fort Frances the number is 807-274-3655.
I took my 8 yr old son last year. My Wife typed a letter w/ her info and his (birthday, ss # and contact ifno) and had it notarized. Nobody even asked for it.
Did the same thing. It will save you a bunch of time if they checked and you did not have it.

Something like this... "I _____ give my consent for Billy to travel with his father (Full Name) to ( ) Resort, ( ) Town, ( ) Province, Canada. Their trip will occure during these dates _____ _____ 2011. If you need, I can be reached at the following numbers. Work Home Cell Thanks, _______" It doesn't need to be notarized, and I don't believe that will actually help in the situation. Don't forget his passport or birth certificate if he doesn't have one yet.

I'm from Florida and took my nephews from Ohio to Quebec when they were younger, It took a bit of explaining why I was from Florida, driving a rental SUV with two 10 year olds from Ohio. But I had a notarized permission letter with all their info including where and when we would be traveling. It came in handy when I got pinched for speeding way up in the Waswanipi area. It would have help to be able to speak French on that one!
